settings.slider-custom-text-desp: I just replaced my hot water heater. I stumbled across this company online and read the good reviews. Price was much better than other companies, so I was skeptical. I called Saturday afternoon, confirmed online Saturday night, and the work was completed Sunday afternoon. I have been so impressed with the service from my phone conversation with Juan to the installation by Alireza. Now I can only hope that the product is as good as the price, technicians, and customer service.

Finally, purchased today, scheduled installation over the weekend. For comparison I have checked with Home Depot and they quoted $2200 +tax. Rheeem 50 Gallon power vent $1489 is the item they will install, so roughly $700 installation fees. They won’t return the old one. Not sure about Costco pricing, they have $300 Gift Card. I don’t think anyone else would sell less than Go Lime. Thanks.

I just had Go Lime install my new hot water tank, and everything went great. No issues at all, and you can't beat the price. Some people complained about the fan on the hot water tank being super loud, but I don’t have that issue at all. In fact, it’s quieter than my old tank

This is the third time I met Ashraf to do the services at my home, everytime the next experience waa wonderful than the previous one, he is extremely knowledgeable and imparts wonderful professionalism. He not only fixed the issues but gave me the tips & advices how to maintain and keep running the systems. He is very courteous, friendly and helpful, I will definitely will recommend him100% for the jobs and want to see him if I have the service calls.

settings.pd-heading: Does my monthly price ever go up?
settings.pd-desp: Our pricing isn’t a flashy promotional rate - it’s fair and transparent from the start. Over time, there may be minor adjustments to ensure you continue receiving top-notch service. But don’t worry - we’re talking about just a dollar or two per year at most. No surprises, just straightforward savings. Plus, you can purchase the equipment at any time, giving you ultimate savings and flexibility.

Moving? No problem. Our Go Flex plan is fully transferable to the next homeowner, allowing them to seamlessly pick up where you left off. Just let us know 30 days before your move, and we’ll handle the rest. We’re here to make your move hassle-free, just the way it should be.

settings.pd-heading: What is the warranty with my purchase?
settings.pd-desp: With the Go Flex Program, you’re 100% covered—24/7/365—for both parts and labour, including annual maintenance. If you choose to purchase the equipment, you’ll receive the standard manufacturer’s warranty. Start with the Go Flex Program to enjoy all the benefits we offer, and when you’re ready, you can purchase the equipment at your convenience.

settings.pd-heading: How long have you been in business?
settings.pd-desp: Go Lime has been keeping homes comfortable since 2011. With over 150,000+ customers served across Ontario, we’ve spent more than a decade earning the trust of homeowners just like you. Partnering with trusted names like Enbridge, Home Depot, and Walmart, you can count on the Go Lime team to take care of your family.

settings.pd-heading: Is Go Flex a rental, and what is the term?
settings.pd-desp: Go Flex isn’t a never-ending rental contract. It’s a game-changer: an industry-first flexible 180-month subscription with an anytime purchase option. Here’s how it works: 50% of your monthly payment reduces your purchase price, while the other 50% covers 24/7 service, annual maintenance, and unlimited parts and labour coverage. You get all the perks of ownership without the headaches—and the flexibility to purchase the equipment at any time.

settings.pd-heading: What type of air conditioner is best for my home?
settings.pd-desp: The best choice depends on your home size, insulation, and layout. Central air conditioners are ideal for whole-home cooling, while ductless split systems work well in homes without ductwork or for room-by-room control. Our team can help you choose the most efficient system based on your needs.

settings.pd-heading: How is SEER2 rating important when buying an AC?
settings.pd-desp:
The SEER2 (Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio 2) rating measures how efficiently an air conditioner cools over a season. Higher SEER2 ratings mean lower energy bills. In Ontario, look for units rated 13.4 SEER2 or higher for optimal efficiency and rebate eligibility.
Want to dive deeper? Check out our blog:What Is SEER2 and Why It Matters for Your Ontario AC System?

settings.pd-heading: What size air conditioner do I need?
settings.pd-desp: AC size is based on your home's square footage, insulation level, number of windows, and more. An undersized unit will struggle to cool your home, while an oversized one can shortenthe cycle and waste energy. We offer professional sizing to match the right tonnage for your space.

settings.pd-heading: How long does an air conditioner last?
settings.pd-desp: Most central AC units last between 12 to 15 years with proper maintenance. Regular servicing and timely filter replacements help extend the lifespan and maintain performance.

settings.pd-heading: Is there a difference between split AC and central AC?
settings.pd-desp: Yes. Central AC cools the entire home through ductwork and is controlled by one thermostat. Split or ductless systems provide room-specific cooling and are ideal for homes without existing ducts.
